title: Introducing: Inch-time
body:
I’m discovering that one of the main joys of this whole music blog malarkey is when awesome artists start finding their way to you, rather than vice-versa.

I can imagine that it must get thoroughly tiresome when you start to get five hundred emails a day from delusional tryhards and their management, claiming to be the next whoever, but I’m not nearly at that stage yet, and luckily, London-based producer **Inch-time** has the tunes to back up the claims made in his press release.  Born **Stefan Panczak** in Adelaide, **Inch-time**‘s latest album **_The Floating World_** deals in the kind of vaguely downbeat, organic electronica that makes the perfect companion for late-night contemplation, particularly on the longing, reverberant _Of Times Past_. Another personal favourite, _Late Spring_, lives up to its title, blooming into gorgeous melody just before its close, while _Suspension_ dips dubby toes into sparkling waters, not far from the likes of **The Cinematic Orchestra**. **Panczak** draws from a myriad of sometimes unexpected influences over the album’s course, rendering **_The Floating World_** a diverse work that knows where it came from, but goes somewhere completely different.

**_The Floating World_** is out now on [Mystery Plays Records](http://mysteryplaysrecords.com/releases/inch-time-the-floating-world-new-release "'Mystery Plays' were among the earliest formally developed plays in Medieval Europe. Who knew?"), and the video for album track _Electric Blue_ is below, for your viewing pleasure. Featured image by **Benji Davies** and **Jim Field** at [Frater](http://www.fraterfilms.com/fraterblog/?cat=23 "And 'frater' is Latin for 'brother', in both the familial AND ecclesiastical senses. Wow. ").
